Stef Coetzee - July 01, 2020

  • This is the title of the older post Stef Coetzee
    July 01, 2020

I’ve been listening to Landslide by Fleetwood Mac quite a bit of late. The lyrics follow below.

Landslide

I took my love, I took it down
I climbed a mountain and I turned around
And I saw my reflection in the snow-covered hills
’Till the landslide brought me down

Oh, mirror in the sky, what is love?
Can the child within my heart rise above?
Can I sail through the changing ocean tides?
Can I handle the seasons of my life?

Well, I’ve been afraid of changing
’Cause I’ve built my life around you
But time makes you bolder
Even children get older
And I’m getting older too

Well, I’ve been afraid of changing
’Cause I’ve built my life around you
But time makes you bolder
Even children get older
And I’m getting older too
Oh, I’m getting older too

Oh, take my love, take it down
Oh, climb a mountain and turn around
And if you see my reflection in the snow-covered hills
Well the landslide will bring it down
And if you see my reflection in the snow-covered hills
Well the landslide will bring it down, oh oh
The landslide will bring it down
